summary: The Department of Veterans Affairs operates 300 Vet Centers throughout the U.S. that provide counseling services to military veterans and their families. The agency has changed how it assesses Vet Center counselors' productivity and its expectations for the number of clients that the counselors see each week. But the VA hasn't evaluated how these new expectations may affect veteran care or counselor practices. For example...
title: VA Vet Centers: Evaluations Needed of Expectations for Counselor Productivity and Centers' Staffing
